title: This Robot is FUN!!!!!
text:
I cannot begin to tell you how much fun our entire family is having with this robot! (Well, almost the entire family...the cats hate it but the dog LOVES it!) I am truly impressed as to how well this toy works and all of the features it includes. I usually mention at the end of a review my opinion as to whether an item is worth the price but I feel the need to start with that in this review. I cannot believe how low the price of Rock Robot is. I would expected it to cost FAR more than it does!

Other than needing place 2 AA batteries (NOT included) in the controller, there is no assembly required. The robot has an on/off button on the front and rather than using batteries, it is charged using a USB cord (included). Charging does take a few hours but then Rock takes off, moves, dances, sings, plays, etc for a good 30-45 minutes straight before needing to be charged again.

As soon as its turned on, Rock giggles and introduces himself. He lights up as well. The remote controller has a SO many different functions and works well. We have experienced a few times when we had to turn the robot off and back on again after using a lot of the controller functions in a short time. (The robot will stay lit but not perform the controller functions. Its truly NOT a big deal. Turning off and back on again is all it takes and he's back in action) Rock can walk or slide; frontwards or backwards, fast/slow-pretty much whatever you want him to do. If he's gliding and comes to a stop, he doesn't tip over! I keep thinking he's going to tip but he has not fallen over even one time! He dances, sings and even moonwalks. He has a bunch of stories to tell as well with the simple press of a button. The volume as well as the voice is easily controlled with the controller.

The gesture sensing function is pretty neat. A simple command using your hand will make Rock move backward or forward/left or right.

Rock appears to be well-made. As mentioned, he hasn't fallen over once. It glides/walks/dances, etc VERY easily on flooring. (Rock does not work well on thick carpet) The controller is easy to use as well. I feel the need to mention my husband has a hearing impairment and cannot always understand what the robot is saying-he has trouble making out the words. However, the rest of us can understand it perfectly fine.

We truly are having a blast playing with this robot. I cannot recommend it enough. Its fun and entertaining and WOW, is the price ever incredibly LOW!

title: Fun For Cats AND Humans!/**REVISED REVIEW! NEW INFORMATION/CHANGE TO RATING
text:
Late last year, for a week or so, all 3 of our cats sat gathered around the stove in the kitchen just staring at it. I quickly figured that was probably NOT a good sign-that we likely had an uninvited guest in our home. A few days later, I was proven correct. Got up early one morning to take the dog out and there was a dead mouse by the front door waiting to greet me, with 2 of the 3 cats sitting close by, proud of what they had left for me. (I don't think I've ever screamed louder in my entire life than I did that morning! lolol-I did heap praise on them after I calmed down) Unfortunately, the cats were once again gathered around the stove watching...and a few days later, mouse #2 was waiting for us to clean up. (Thank God I didn't find that one)

As soon as I saw this cat toy, I immediately ordered it. Though one of our 3 cats who helped catch the mice has since gone to the Rainbow Bridge, I knew the other 2, Miss Piggy and Squeaky, would have loads of fun playing with this toy. (And if I'm being honest, I want to keep them in tip-top shape in case any further 'uninvited guests' find their way into our home! lol) The mouse (I see it more of a rat than a mouse) is nearly 11 inches long from the tip of the nose to the end of the tail. It has beady red eyes that light up. From a distance, I believe people (who don't know its fake) could mistaken it for a real mouse (rat). It has gray fur and what appears to be sharp teeth sticking out of its mouth. (The teeth are NOT sharp, they only appear that way) The mouse takes 3 AAA batteries (not included) and the remote controller takes 2 AAA batteries as well. (not included) The only assembly required is placing the batteries in the mouse and controller. A nice, small screwdriver comes with the toy, something I especially appreciate! (Works on my eyeglass hinges as well!) The controller allows you to move the mouse forward and backward. (Both of our young kids were able to operate the remote control without issue while we stood with them) It does work on carpet but works far better on flooring. As soon as we turned it on and began steering it around the room, 2 cats immediately popped out of their beds, their curiosity piqued. Both cats watched the mouse zip around the floor for a bit. As soon as it got close to Miss Piggy, she jumped and ran under the bed. lol. But Squeaky...he was far braver than Piggy and watched it up close. We'd stop it for awhile and he'd creep closer and closer to it, staring at it....and then we'd start it up again. lol. It was loads of fun to watch him with this toy. It certainly kept him entertained for quite some time! Piggy stayed hidden but she's a nosy cat...she'll get the hang of it before long.

This is a fun toy not only for cats but for cat owners to operate for their cats! We had loads of fun watching the cat's reaction. Its a great way for your cat to get some exercise as well. Very easy to operate also!

UPDATE******************

We got this out again tonight to play with. This time, the dog had more fun chasing it than the cats. However, after just under 15 minutes of use, it stopped working entirely! Even though I had used brand new batteries in the mouse and the controller when I first got it (a day ago), I replaced all 5 batteries. It does NOT work at all. Nothing happened to it. It did not fall, it didn't' crash, it was not damaged in any way, it simply stopped working altogether in the blink of an eye. And that's a darn shame because my cat AND dog had fun with it. Due to the fact that it stopped working entirely after just under 30 minutes of total use since we got it, and the fact we did nothing to break it/make it stop working, I've changed my rating/review of this item. I cannot recommend an item that stops working out of the blue as this did. For the minutes that it did work, my pets loved it. And we loved watching them have fun.

title: So Much Fun and a Quality Product!
text:
I'm not a crafty person at all. I'm terrible when it comes to any type of arts and crafts. When I tell you that i can't even draw stick figures, I'm not exaggerating. I'm THAT bad.
I was looking for some fun crafts to do with my 2 1/2 year old granddaughter. This was a bit above her age level but I got it anyway. And she was fine with it. She had NO problem at all! We had a wonderful time painting our butterfly magnets a variety of colors and later (after they dried) decorating them with stickers that were included. It may sound odd, but the paintbrush was the perfect size for my granddaughter's small hands. The paint (included) colors were so bright and perfect for butterflies! She was so VERY proud of her artwork and had fun handing out her magnets to family members. We had fun and WILL be doing this again in the near future! I can't wait for our next crafts day!

title: Ridiculously easy and fun to play!
text: This little game was a surprisingly huge hit in our family! The box itself is constructed extremely well. It sits flat on the table with no tipping or rocking at all. The logos, and numbers are all printed or applied well and look sharp and legible on the end product. The lid fits perfectly! The only issue we have discovered in our month of nightly use, is that all US coins (pennies, dimes and quarters) fit into and stand upright in the slots.. all except for nickles. They are simple too thick to fit. We learned this after our 3 yr old granddaughter tried to force a nickle into the #4 slot, gouging the surrounding wood in the process. This is not a big deal as my husband was able to re-router the slots to be ever so slightly wider so now all coins will fit into all slots with ease. Overall, this is a great game. Easy for all ages to play. Heck, it's a great game to have the littles play with you as they'll learn their numbers so they can place their coins. My husband and I keep this on our main table and play it at least once per evening. It's such a simply game that you can play it while having a conversation. It really takes no thought at all. We took it camping and played it when we were forced inside during a storm. Thinking of getting one to keep in the camper so we never forget it! Even grandma asked me to order one for her house so she can play with her friends! Highly recommended!

title: Fast, easy and quite adorable!
text: I drive a school bus for a K-12 school and was looking for something to hand out to my kids for Valentine's Day. These cards fit the bill perfectly! Not too expensive, not too excessive.. just right! The cards are printed on decent card stock that took pen ink well without smudging, the words and print were all clear, legible and not smeared and the colors were bright. The included bags fit the back of the cards and the glue strips (which I didn't realize were included!) adhered to both the bags and the cards very well. I filled the bags with conversation hearts (about 15 per bag), wrote my kiddos' names on them and they were a huge hit! The order comes with enough cards, bags and glue strips to make up 40 sets. At the current price of $18, it works out to just $0.45 each.. a wonderful deal!! I live in rural Wyoming so the rustic mason jar design was perfect for me and my kiddos too! I have 8 regulars who ride every day so this purchase will last me for 4 more years! When I do run out, I will be immediately replenishing with another order (or three!!). Highly recommend!!

title: Easy to inflate and fits big butts
text: My parents recently retired and moved to Florida and the first thing they did to their new home was have a pool installed. So I got this Inflatable Pool Float for them and they love it! It is made of thick material that will resist punctures, inflated easily, is sturdy and large enough for a full size adult (my dad in 6'2 and tips the scales at around 240) to hop on it without it tipping and my mom especially likes the oversized drink holder, having (quite merrily) reported that her margarita not only fit but never spilled a drop even when getting on and off. Overall, this float was a major score for me in the Daughter Department and I highly recommend it for anyone who has a pool (I'd get one but living in Wyoming, I neither have nor want a pool LOL)!

As it is, it performs perfectly in our backyard and garage (it even peeled up some of our garage floor paint when I ended up spinning donuts while learning the controls! HA!) 5 stars, A+, HIGHLY recommend!

title: Skip's Score: 2 Paws Up!
text:
When Skip, our Pembroke Welsh Corgi, was a puppy, I got one of those basic blue kiddie wading pools for him. He loved it! Now 6 years old, he hasn't had a pool since he was a puppy (we just haven't been able to have one where we've lived in that time). This Splash Sprinkle Pad arrived Friday and we set it up today.

Set up is extremely fast and easy. Filling it with water is what takes the most time. Once you have your hose connected and turn on your water, the water fills the outer rim (which has evenly spaced tiny holes in it) of the pool first, then once the rim is full the water will jet upward out of holes... it's those jets of water that fill the pool as they land. Once full of water, it is obviously quite heavy. The material used is quite thick and stood up to Skip's feet just fine (I did his nails about a week prior).

It took Skip awhile to warm up to it since, like I said, he's only had a pool before. He wasn't too keen at first of the water jets (the sprinkler part of Splash Sprinkler Pad). But once I got his yard ball in the pool, he started re-thinking this new pool idea! Soon enough he was jumping in without any encouragement and playing with his ball. We were having such a fun time splashing and barking that we drew the attention of the neighbor dogs.. one even came over to check it out too! LoL

When the fun and interest had faded, we simply disconnected the hose and stepped on the outer rim of the pool to push some water out and once enough water weight had drained out, we hung the pool on our back deck to continue to drain. Here in a little while, we will fold it up and store it away for another hot day!

Bottom line - this is an awesome "toy" for your dogs (and your neighbor's dogs!) and kids! I can't wait for my grandkids to visit again. They're always asking to play in our sprinklers so this will be a fun toy to pull out for them too! It folds up well and doesn't take much storage space as well! Highly recommended! Skip's final score: 2 paws up!

title: High quality, just larger than expected
text: These plushies are if great quality. Very soft and surprisingly highly detailed. I returned them, however, as they were slightly larger than anticipated. Since I was looking for something that would fit in a specific space, I did note the size mentioned in the description prior to purchasing. I used the given measurement to compare to the space I was going to put them in and ultimately determined that they would fit. And they would have, if the given measurement was true. These are slightly (just shy of 2 inches) larger than mentioned. Normally this wouldn't be any issue and I would have kept them, however I had no other use for them outside of my one plan. So, despite everything else they had going for them (and the fact that I am a die-hard Star Wars addict, I returned them. If you are even remotely considering purchasing these plushies, please do not hesitate. They are all cute, high quality, soft, fairly priced and would make excellent gifts or stocking stuffers. If I ever find another location or have another use for them, I will definitely be reordering.

title: From Tokyo to Story Editor
text: Okay, I'm 76 years old, what do I want Godzilla for? I'm a writer and I needed an editor to check on my storylines. I live in a rural area and editors are nonexistent. Since my local news station uses a base station by a lake and has Godzilla as a weather icon there, I thought why not? If he can be out there in all kinds of weather, why can't he edit my stories? So that is why I purchased Godzilla. As a critic, he is harsh, but fortunately, he hasn't turned any of my work to ash. Seriously, he looks great and I'm old enough to know that. Should be a welcome addition to any family, at any age.

title: Sturdy
text: Rosie is a 'squeaker surgeon'. When she receives a new toy, the first thing she does is remove the squeaker inside the toy with precision. Gumby is well constructed and too firm a plush for her to locate the squeaker and remove it. Matter of fact, she is so fond of Gumby that she has made no attempts. His size is so perfect for her to carry around and play catch with... and sometimes be her nap buddy. This toy is so well constructed and made that it puts those much higher-priced toys to shame. I am so glad Gumby was affordable because, despite this old lady's fixed income, her little Rosie deserves the best.

title: Fun toy, ever for an old lady.
text: Smaller than you would think from the pic; but no matter.  It didn't cost much and gave us tons of fun on Christmas Day.  We're old ladies and were out side driving this thing all over.  It's not large enough to hop curbs and doesn't have tires that are well suited for grass and dirt.  But it raced up and down the sidewalk and street and is immediately responsive to remote commands.  Can't vouch for the distance the remote works.  But we let it race for a good half a block with no response issues.  To race it farther would seem impracticable if we didn't want a real car to run over it.  Oh oh!  We strapped (with a rubber band( a squeaky toy on top with the tail dragging and with a lot more effort and attention span, I'm pretty sure we could get our little dogs to go after it.  1 was interested; but by the time she started to bark and lung at it, we humans had had enough or the day.  (Look, don't try that at home and then blame the manufacturer when your dog is whopped on the snout or the stuffed animal toy gets stuck in the wheels or whatever.  Nonsense.  If you were to try something like that and your dog got hurt or the toy destroyed this is where you chalk it up to good fun at a price...... although maybe the manufacturer - or anyone reading this will make one and make a ton of money as our 1 dog was clearly ready to rumble.  This is all an aside.  The purpose of this toy is drive it around, in circles, crash it without destroying it - the first couple times hahaha - at less than $25 bucks.  I pay way more for a few hours of golf).  Love it.

title: Package in typical condition for store shelves.
text: So far I've bought one of these, and received one as a gift, both from Amazon. As collectors items, they're not quite ideal. The original package on both was slightly damaged in some way, much as one might expect from an item found on a store shelf that had been roughly handled in stocking, or by customers. This is not really the fault of the handlers, but of Barbie for inferior packaging. It is fine for my purposes, but may not be acceptable for someone who collects things such as this and expects new products to be in pristine condition. So, as a Barbie, it's a typical retail package. As a collector's item, the original package is a bit flawed.

title: Flimsy.  Poor quality.  Horrible value.
text:
I can't believe I paid nearly $50 for this thing. It's the price I paid for being rushed. The translucent lens does not fit the frame which causes it to pop off the frame once in a while. It does a poor job of baffling the light so you get uneven illumination. The ridges are not prominent enough causing issues with the slides sliding off the lens. I can't think of a single positive thing to say about this. It is, by far, the worst purchase I've made in years.

And another thing: It will not hold 40 slides as they claim. It holds only 35. In order to 40 you must overlap slides.

title: Fun in the dark
text: [[VIDEOID:20e8d8dd23a8527bb6075806922363d5]] Nice, sturdy, bright "ball". My kids were kicking it at night and it tumbled pretty far. The ball is bright so you can't lose it in the dark. The color changing is a nice feature. It is well-made so you can kick it, throw it or bounce it and the ball won't break.  The box includes instructions for Cosmic Kick the Can gameplay but we haven't played it yet. My boys like to kick it into the soccer goal.

title: Great Valentine's Day Cards for son to give out to class
text: This is a great alternative to the Valentine's Day cards with candy or pencils. Kids will love playing with the slime. And the colorful sprinkle toppings makes it even more fun. No odor to the slime either. You get 30 Valentine's Day cards, 30 slime and 30 self-adhesive baggies. The slime and sprinkles are each individually wrapped. There's even room in the baggie to add a piece of candy. I got these a couple of weeks before Valentine's day and now my son wants to play with all the slime. Hopefully we will still have enough for his whole class in a couple of weeks. I just wish the sayings on the cards were more appropriate for an 8 yr old boy. Wasn't crazy about the cards that said "I love you", "With you Forever" or "Belong to You".

title: Family fun!
text: [[VIDEOID:8cdecf049b08d771973a4e27ebee1d8d]] My two boys, 8 and 12, had a blast playing this (especially after we figured out the function on how to not be hit by the other gun). Two guns, 3 projection cards and a projector are included in the box. You will need 3 AA batteries for each gun and 4 AA batteries for the projector (not included). You can compete against each other or play on the same team. You choose between 5 different weapons of different fire power. There are 2 different game modes to play.  I pointed the projector at the wall. The further back the projector was, the bigger the objects were displayed on the wall. It probably needed to be a little higher since the object was near the floor a couple of times. Objects were bright and clear. Best of all, you can also use the guns as regular laser guns where they could shoot each other.

title: Extremely disappointed!
text: I've owned several drones and was looking forward to just goofing around with this one in the yard.  Unfortunately, the sensitivity on the controls is way overbalanced and the drone simply continues to rise, rise, rise to the heavens, and even the slightest light touch downward on the controls causes the drone to plummet like a rock!  The propellers actually STOP rotating and the drone simply plunges downward.  Catching it with the controller and pushing it skyward results in a bouncing flight path that eventually ends badly.  I'm not an inexperienced drone flyer -- I've owned several and enjoy the fun of zipping around the yard in figure-eights and loops, but this drone does none of that.  It has been permanently retired to the island of bad toys.  I'm just glad that the experience didn't cost me more than $50!

title: Awesome rig highly recommend it
text:
First impressions are very good solid build and a very capable rig out of the box. I have a course in my back yard 1st attempt made it through no problem..

First thing you will notice about the rig is the weight it's perfect for the size. I added a little extra weight in the front to help with grip on uphill long climbing. But no problem with any part. It definitely blows the RGT out of the water.

This is a great sturdy well bulit 1/18 crawler details are incredible with a metal frame. Strong thick plastics used it has alloy oil filled shocks the tires are a bit hard but should soften over use. The rig's weight just feels right. Panda Hobby states the X1 has wheel weights installed stock and it seems like it wants to stick to the ground the center of gravity on the X1 is pretty low allowing lots of tilt. The servo is mounted on the axel but has enough clearance for as much flex as the suspension can allow very nice touch. I really like the fact that out of the box I can start to modify it with tools supplied. The shock towers have 6 available mounting locations it's set to middle height out of the box. The body posts are adjustable as well but in case you want to raise the body for any reason. The X supports molded into the part body posts make them solid. Body clips are bent in 2 spots making them a breeze install and remove, one cool thing is posts tops can be removed with 2 screws in my case I epoxied magnets instead to eliminate body clips (10 min mod). The X1 comes with 2 batterys batteries last about 15 to 20 min when the battery is dead the vehicle automatically applies the brakes it completely stopped rig going down a 45Â° ramp. each battery take about 35 min to recharge via USB charger. The body has a great appearance with its angry Jeep grill with working ch 3 controlled headlights and light bar also had auto brake and reverse lights that perfectly match the vehicles motion. Nice little details like the door handles, hood cowl, mirrors and wipers make just a bit cooler It comes with a spare tire to mount on as well as 2 additional sticker options for rear 3 windows and a small set of fun decals to put on the truck. From what I can tell it's ready to be modified and have accessories bolted on I can't wait to see what they come up with.

The Tetra X1 definitely has more than enough power to climb anything in front of it. The remote has a 3 position speed control. In my opinion the low is set to low to climb even an easy hill it works great for easy flat Rocky courses. Medium is a great position for crawling it allows you to really get a feel for the power the rig does have without it being to overpowering when learning to use it, when you ease into the throttle you can hear the motor start to whine and smoothly move the truck but has enough power in this range to climb a decent grade Rock Hill without being underpowered. High (adult mode) is very fun especially if you want to try a speed run pop a wheelie or speed around those pesky slow pokes in my case my kids , while in high the to achieve a crawl takes some getting used to but once mastered you can power through even the toughest courses. but it can be touchy if you don't have a steady throttle finger so not recommend for kids haha.

The X1 handled sand dunes no problem and absolutely loved wet sand. With ease it will climb a 45Â° ramp with plenty of power if you want to speed up it instead, If climbing going directly from the 45Â° ramp to flat top the truck did high center but adjusting the shock towers to raise the truck fixed this (5 min mod with tools supplied). Raising the truck also allowed it to completely drive over my garden hose no problem where it got stuck stock. From what no notice it didn't affect the center of gravity of the rig to much as it handles hills and slants just like stock. The steering is strong enough for the truck and is very responsive so no complaints there.

Cons. No auto drag brake makes going down hills a challenge but with good throttle/brake control you can easily navigate any downhill course. The L-M-H on the remote is cool just wish it was a bit more powerful on low so it can be used.

Overall it's a great rig and I really enjoy driving it.

text:
Very challenging puzzle. Like someone else said, you can get the border and the mirror together, and then you're in trouble. The rest of the puzzle is an awfully difficult slog. When puzzles are this difficult, I'm no longer having any fun. I like puzzles to be a little challenging but not nearly this much. I'm usually pretty good at seeing color variation and being able to group pieces together, but that didn't matter much with this one.
We probably will not be trying any more from this series and won't be doing this puzzle again.

title: Fun
text: I loved this puzzle. I found it fun and not too challenging. My husband seemed to find it more challenging than me because he can't see small variance in colors as easily as I can (I guess). No missing pieces. And it's pretty! I'm definitely going to keep this one to do again in the future.

title: Missing 1 piece
text: This puzzle was ok. My husband liked it more than I did. I found it a little too difficult for my liking--too much wood, too much red, that sort of thing. No missing pieces.

title: Great puzzle! But tiny!
text:
We were appalled at the small box for the 1000 piece puzzle. When we opened it, we couldn't believe how tiny the pieces were! I was actually dreading attempting this puzzle, sure it was going to take forever.

It actually only took a few days. The pieces have letters stamped on the back, so we first divided the pieces up between A, B, C, and D sections. I don't think we could've done the puzzle without doing that first. Then my husband and I each took a section to work on. It came together beautifully.

The asteroid fields were the hardest. My husband got frustrated with this puzzle, but I had no problem with it. I think he must not be as good at seeing nuances in colors and patterns. I finished his second section and completed the puzzle myself. I enjoyed it so much that I'll probably keep it to do again in a few years rather than donating it like we do with most of our puzzles.

The pieces were strong and not thin at all. They wouldn't be easy to bend and we didn't have any problems at all with that sort of thing.

My only problem was that the pieces didn't really "snap together". They were very loose. So if you bump a set you have together or need to move them, then they fall apart easily. On the upside, this meant that if you put two pieces together and they didn't want to come apart easily, then they probably weren't supposed to be together.

title: Leaks like a sieve
text:
This thing leaks like a sieve--from both the plug where you fill it up and from the spout. So if you plan on using it to scare away birds or squirrels or anything other than with the intention of getting yourself wet, look for something else.

Update: Turns out it's not just leaking from the spout and the plug, but from the seam that runs down the middle of the gun where the two sides of the gun are melded together. You can't store it in any fashion while it has water in it without dripping water from the seam, even if you stand it level without being completely full so it doesn't leak out the spout or the plug. Reducing stars from three to two, and the two are only because it still shoots water.

title: Great two-player game
text: This is a great, easy game that's quick to learn. My husband and I play it regularly with just the two of us so it's a great two-player game (so rare!).

title: Fun
text: These are a lot of fun. A bit of a learning curve and I suck at it but my husband is good and it's fun anyway.

title: It doesn't fly, it GLIDES
text:
Ok, I get it that it has to be lightweight. But it's pretty much styrofoam.

That isn't the worst part though. This thing doesn't even fly! You have to throw it to get it to GLIDE, and then *maybe* you'll get to turn it with the controls if it doesn't turn and dive itself first. And don't even think of trying to use it if there is even the slightest breeze! Biggest waste of 50 bucks I've ever spent. What a disappointment.

title: Nice little  set
text:
I've been using this all evening and have had fun with it. I've had zero problems with the pieces being flimsy or the putty not sticking. I don't know what other people are doing to make it difficult for themselves. It's a small set which is all I want or need, just to play with along with my other crafts. If you're looking for more pieces then don't look here-- there's only one ring and six wheels plus a "bar" piece a "rack." Then the putty and two pens. I use Sharpie ultra fine pens on watercolor paper to prevent bleeding.

We got it for about ten bucks on deal of the day (down from $12). I wouldn't pay much more than that and feel bad for the people who paid $45 for it.

title: strange game
text:
I loved the original Life game, and I didn't realize this one would be so different when I bought it, which is a bummer now. They changed a bunch of rules and added some things that overall make the game more complicated, and that's all it does. It doesn't really add anything more to the game (make it any more fun), it just makes it more confusing and annoying ot have to constantly read through the directions. The board is also kind of difficult to read compared the old game.

We weren't thrilled with this new version. We'll probably just play it as best we can the old fashioned way instead. I'd recommend the old Game of Life over this 50th anniversary one any day.

title: Each turn takes too long
text:
Ok we play a lot of Caton in our house, at least one game every other weekend.

We bought the expansion to change it up. We liked how you could phase into the whole expansion and new rules, as there is a lot!

The expansion overall could be fun but we found that each turn took way too long; by the time your next turn came around, you were bored and disengaged.

Since we bought the expansion we actually are not playing caton as much and choosing different games.

Overall I think the expansion is well made, adds on to the caton experience, but we found that it became a slow game.

title: Nice looking board
text:
Years ago I had a revolving board that cost a lot less and was darn near perfect even though it didn't have the storage base.
Now for this board set. Nice graphics, nice storage drawer, nice racks...not so nice is the random height tiles. I could understand if the tiles were hand ground and carved, but for machined pieces the quality control lacks a lot. I know it seems trivial, but when playing, the difference in thickness is noticeable not only in the feel, but the other player can see the difference. Paying almost $200 for this Scrabble set makes me feel I'm a bit off my rocker. Excluding the tiles, it will be a nice set to pass down generations, hopefully they won't be bothered as much about the tiles as I am. I make no recommendations for or against you purchasing after you've read my review.

title: I read a review where a customer set this pool up on large foam puzzle blocks and that sounded perfect as I would be setting the pool up in ...
text: Can't find the leaks.  I read a review where a customer set this pool up on large foam puzzle blocks and that sounded perfect as I would be setting the pool up in a grass area where you never can be sure a twig or stone won't poke through the bottom.  Regardless, water was seeping out from somewhere while I was filling it.  If you step on the puzzle pieces muddy water squirts through.  No, the leak is not near the plug area, the ground stayed dry there.  Also, as the water filled, the seat totally deflated.  I could not find any air bubbles anywhere near the seat areal nor could I locate the water leak/seep in the pool in order to patch it..  It is a very slow water leak as there is still quite a bit of water in the pool.  As soon as I get the energy and time I will empty the water and air and return the pool. For me, even at a great price, it is not worth it.  What a pain.

title: Good Value
text: I would have given the holder 5 stars if the back of the side panels had been finished. The side panel backing looks like the back of a picture frame so you either have to leave the holder laying open to cover them or find a creative way to decorate them. For the money spent, I didn't expect to have to spend additional money to avoid having an eye sore on my coffee table. Luckily, the supplies - glue gun, box cutter, 3 pack canvas boards, Velcro discs, and material only cost $30 at Hobby Lobby for everything - and about 45 minutes to complete. My final step will be to laminate photos of our bikes and Velcro them to the top. Overall, it is a nice quality holder and does not need â€œspruced upâ€ if you don't mind leaving it open at all times. I would recommend this for anyone starting or displaying their personal jet chip collection.

title: Great for the grandkids
text:
Every time we go to some nighttime event, someone is selling glow sticks for $1 or $2 each. At $40 for 500 of them, this is a great deal at about 12 cents each. I told my grandkids that if they sell them on the street at 2 for a $ they coulld get $50 for each tube. That's a lot better than selling lemonade and you don't have the mess.
They like to just play with them, so maybe I'll have to set up my own booth. Seriously, this is a great gift for the kids. I don't know how long they last because the kids get tired of them after a while, but it's great to have a bunch of these for them to share with their friends.

title: Very nice Backgammon Set
text:
I played backgammon about 30 years ago and really enjoyed it. I had a set but some of the stones were missing so I decided it was time to get a new one. This looked reasonable and although there were some negative reviews, they didn't seem to make sense and were not serious enough to keep me from buyng it. Returns with Amazon are pretty easy, so if it was bad, I'd just return it.
I can say the negative reviews were not justified in the set I received. Sure, it's not leather and it's not that large, but it's pretty much the same size as the last one I had (the inner board is 13.5" by 15"). It was only $40, and I couldn't justify spending a lot more to get a higher quality board. This is very nice and just what I needed.
There were some negative comments about the instruction booklet saying the color's of the points was mixed up, but I seem to recall they can be any color as long as you can tell the difference. This setup is definitely consistent with other sets and books on Backgammon, so there is really no issue with the setup. It may not be suitable for a Backgammon Grand Master, but it works ok for average players like me.
The box it came in was nice, so it could be given as a present and if you are looking for a good quality Backgammon set, then definitely give this one a dance. You will not regret it.

title: Small and easy to break
text: I got these for my grandson who loves transformers. These are knock offs so the names are not the real transformer names but they seemed OK at first.  When he started playing with them, they started to frustrate him because of the poor quality and the difficulty in transforming them.  The helicopter rotors broke almost immediately and the others were difficult to transform.  Also the sizes are odd, the Optimus Prime knock off was smaller than all the others, so they are not all to scale.  Despite the issues, he liked them and is still playing with one or two of the ones that survived.  Not bad for a cheap knock off product, but if you are looking for quality transformers you should get the name brand ones.
